wikipedia_page.main: Mary Forrest George, née Baxter (24 January 1940 – 12 July 2010), well known as Elizabeth Thornton (her mother's name) is a British-Canadian writer of 31 historical romance novels from 1986 to 2010.

response: *"Saving Celeste" in the anthology MY GUARDIAN ANGEL, 1995 (with Sandra Chastain, Kay Hooper, Susan Krinard and Elizabeth Thornton)

Current research has suggested many illnesses which Pappenheim may have had. Medical researcher Elizabeth Thornton, after interviewing many of Freud's early patients, suggested that Pappenheim had tuberculous meningitis,O Anna: being Bertha Pappenheim, Robert Kaplan. a view supported by professor of psychology Hans Eysenck. Others have suggested it was encephalitis, a form of brain inflammation.Webster, Richard (1996). Why Freud was wrong. Sin, science and psychoanalysis. London: Harper Collins. Many have also suggested that she suffered from a form of temporal lobe epilepsy since many of her symptoms, including imagined smells, are common symptoms of types of epilepsy.http://www.pep-web.org/document.php?id=APA.035.0387A According to one perspective, "examination of the neurological details suggests that Anna suffered from complex partial seizures exacerbated by drug dependence."
